intro: Gardenia thailandica, commonly known as Thai gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. The flowers, which bloom in summer, are prized for their beauty and are often used in ornamental horticulture.
